name: SnowGlider
description:
One day in February, when I heard my friends complaining “why doesn’t it snow in Edinburgh, I used to think there will be a lot of snowy days in such high latitude area”, I came up with this idea.  The player can control a glider and is able to generate snow during gliding, when snow reaches buildings, roofs of buildings will become white. The goal of the game is to let snow cover as much area in the city as possible, before the snow fuel (or time) runs out. The inspiration of the character is from one of my favorite cartoon character—Kaito Kuroba in Detective Conan.

The scene of the game is in Edinburgh, I modeled it like an island in the air, to make it more magical. The buildings are generated using OpenStreetMap API, they have almost the same position and height as the realistic world has, while don’t have much detail.
